subject: Re: Query about passing parameters from @Suite to Junit file
msgSnippet: Hi, I am still suffering with this issue. I could only find only the below thing in google: *TestSuite suite= new TestSuite(); suite.addTest(new
messageBody:
Hi,

I am still suffering with this issue.

I could only find only the below thing in google:

*TestSuite suite= new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(new MoneyTest("testMoneyEquals"));
suite.addTest(new MoneyTest("testSimpleAdd"));
TestResult result= suite.run();*

Can any one tell me equivalent of the above in below format:

*import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
import org.junit.runners.Suite;

@RunWith(Suite.class)
@...( {EmployeeTest.class})
*

Pleas help as its very important to me.


Thanks

Deepankar


On Fri, Nov 28, 2008 at 5:11 PM, Deepankar <deepankar.narang@...>wrote:

> Hi,
>
> I have a small issue. I am using Junit 4 and trying to call a junit file
> from test Suite.
>
> *The Suite file* is as follows:-
>
> *import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
> import org.junit.runners.Suite;
>
> @RunWith(Suite.class)
> @...( {EmployeeTest.class})
> public class EmployeeTestAMAllTests {
> }*
>
> *Junit Test Class*
>
> *import org.junit.After;
> import org.junit.Before;
> import org.junit.Test;
>
>
> public class EmployeeTest {
>
> public EmployeeTest(String AM_NAME, String VO_NAME) { //How
> to pass them from the test suite?
> super(AM_NAME, VO_NAME);
> }
>
> @Before
> public void setUp() throws Exception {
> setUpBefore();
> }
> @Test
> public void createRecord() {
> testCreateRecord();
> }
>
> @After
> public void tearDown() throws Exception {
> tearDownAfter();
> }*
>
> The issue I am facing is that I need to pass parameters from the Test Suite
> to the Junit Test Class file for the instantiation of the file. Can anyone
> please help me in this as it is very urgent.
>
> Thanks In advance :-)
>
> Regards,
> Deepankar
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
